metadata.Title: CVE-2023-37327 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow leading to heap overwrite in FLAC image tag handling

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-37327` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gst-plugins-base-1.0 - 1.22.1-1ubuntu1.1
gstreamer1.0-alsa - 1.22.1-1ubuntu1.1
gstreamer1.0-gl - 1.22.1-1ubuntu1.1
gstreamer1.0-plugins-base - 1.22.1-1ubuntu1.1
gstreamer1.0-plugins-base-apps - 1.22.1-1ubuntu1.1
gstreamer1.0-x - 1.22.1-1ubuntu1.1
libgstreamer-gl1.0-0 - 1.22.1-1ubuntu1.1
libgstreamer-plugins-base1.0-0 - 1.22.1-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

gstreamer1.0-gtk3 - 1.22.1-1ubuntu1.2
gstreamer1.0-plugins-good - 1.22.1-1ubuntu1.2
gstreamer1.0-pulseaudio - 1.22.1-1ubuntu1.2
gstreamer1.0-qt5 - 1.22.1-1ubuntu1.2
gstreamer1.0-qt6 - 1.22.1-1ubuntu1.2
libgstreamer-plugins-good1.0-0 - 1.22.1-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Two patches are required to fix this CVE. Main patch is in the "good" package, and second patch is in the "base" package.

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-base1.0 package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.22.1-1ubuntu1.1').
gst-plugins-good1.0 package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.22.1-1ubuntu1.2').
